class.name: AbstractPublicationFeed
class.doc: This class is the super class abstraction for the publisher classes. It defines the core functionality for integrating with the rest of the service framework. A subclass of this class can then define how to manage feed registrations and how to publish for a given feed.

subclass.name: HasPublicationFeed
subclass.brief: Publication functionality for a single feed.

methodtemplate.name: create_publisher
methodtemplate.doc: This method can be invoked when defining the protocol to attach member functions as publisher.

argument.name: function
argument.doc: a void function that takes a byte array argument.

typedef.name: function_type
typedef.doc: The reason to use std::function here instead of function pointers is to ensure support for lambda functions with capture and subsequently member functions from classes with (to this implementation) unknown base class.

method.name: create_publisher
method.doc: This method can be invoked when defining the protocol using either lambda or free functions.

argument.name: function
argument.doc: a void function that takes a byte array argument.
